Interface Border

All Known Implementing Classes:
LineBorder
interface Border

Interface describing an object capable of rendering a border around the edges of a GUIComponent. See the GUIWorld class for examples of how to use this interface. You can write your own border class by implementing this interface. This interface is included in the GUIComponent class to make it easier to use the components by reducing the number of files to copy into a project.

Version:
1.0 01/05/2011
Author:
Ed Parrish
See Also:
LineBorder

Method Summary
 Insets getBorderInsets()
          Returns the insets of the border.
 void paintBorder(GUIComponent c, Graphics g)
          Paints the border for the specified component.
 

Method Detail

paintBorder

void paintBorder(GUIComponent c,
                 Graphics g)
Paints the border for the specified component.

Parameters:
c - The component for which this border is being painted.
g - The graphics context in which to paint.

getBorderInsets

Insets getBorderInsets()
Returns the insets of the border.

Returns:
A new Insets object with the required values needed for drawing the border.
